segments.title: Area Under Curve Significance
segments.summary: Explains how the area under the velocity curve represents the total distance traveled by the car. The segment demonstrates that this area-based interpretation of integrals is a powerful problem-solving tool that applies to many different scenarios.

segments.title: Fundamental Theorem Connection
segments.summary: Discusses how the integral (area under the curve) can be computed by only looking at two points using antiderivatives, despite representing a continuous sum. Explains why this relationship between areas and antiderivatives is remarkable.

segments.title: Negative Area Interpretation
segments.summary: Explains how negative areas under the curve are interpreted when the function goes below the horizontal axis. Introduces the concept of signed area in integral calculations.

segments.title: Area Approximation Method
segments.summary: Demonstrates how to approximate the area under the curve using rectangles. Shows how the width of rectangles (dt) affects the accuracy of the approximation.

segments.title: Basic Area Concept
segments.summary: Introduces how area under a constant velocity graph represents distance traveled. Shows the initial connection between area and the physical quantity being measured.
